page.title: 06FARMING NEAR HATCH BEAUCHAMP
page.content: On arable farms in the late summer, farmers plough the fields. Then they work them with a power harrow and sow the seeds with a drill. After a few days the field is fertilised with chemical fertiliser and slug pellets and later sprayed with weed killer. When the corn has grown, in the summer, it is harvested by a combine harvester and stored. The stalks are baled in round, square or oblong bales, this is then stored as well. Pature land is not usually ploughed. Sometimes the grass is cut and used for silage or hay making and used to feed cattle during the winter. Occasionally the pasture is grazed directly by cattle in the fields.
